The 9 to 6 job, household chores, family responsibilities and Chennai traffic – are they leaving you feeling claustrophobic? It’s probably high time you gave yourself a well-deserved break.  Chennai is surrounded by abundant serene beaches, undulating hills and offbeat trails that can be covered in a weekend trip on a minimal budget.  In this article, we bring you a compilation of some of the best tourist places near Chennai where you can find your solace – from must-visit attractions to top-rated accommodation choices, culinary specialities and the most thrilling adventure activities. So, what are you waiting for? Let the weekend adventure begin! Oh, but before that, check out our list of Chennai’s getaways. Contents ToggleRomantic Getaways From Chennai1. Pondicherry2. Ooty3. Hogenakkal FallsFrequently Asked Questions On Things To Do In Chennai TWT Summary Romantic Getaways From Chennai 1. Pondicherry Pondicherry is probably the most romantic tourist spot if you’re planning a 2 day trip from Chennai. Also known as Puducherry, this seaside, post-colonial town offers a beautiful bohemian experience with its serene beaches, exuberant nightlife, and awe-inspiring French culture and architecture.  We have put together some of the highlights of the town below, but we suggest that you check out our complete guide to Pondicherry before visiting. You can also book a private sightseeing tour of Pondicherry here.  Main Attractions In Pondicherry The Promenade Beach, also called Rock Beach, is perfect for a long romantic walk. Experience a breathtaking sunset while you indulge in a delectable cup of coffee by the beach at Le Café or dine at the Bay of Buddha beachfront restaurant. The boat ride to Paradise Island Beach offers a mesmerizing view of scenic landscapes that leaves you wanting more. The best way to get there is by taking the ferry or motorboat service from the Chunnambar Boat House. Experience French culture at its best as you walk down the cobbled streets of White Town. Marvel at the colorful French styled-villas, get some Insta-worthy pictures and enjoy the authentic cuisine at courtyard restaurants and cafes such as the Celine’s Kitchen and Coromandel Cafe. Their wood-fired pizzas are definitely worth a try. And before you leave Pondicherry, enjoy a traditional French breakfast at Baker Street with mouth-watering croissants, quiches, baguettes, macarons and many more. One of the greatest spiritual destinations, the Sri Aurobindo Ashram attracts spiritual seekers worldwide for its peaceful, meditative environment. Amongst its many departments, the ashram has a library where you can read all of Sri Aurobindo’s works and a publication department from where you can buy them. Timings: 8 am – 12 pm and 2 pm – 6 pm. The church of Sacred Heart Basilica in South Boulevard is a marvelous display of Gothic architecture that appeals to all art lovers. You can visit it on all days between 5 am and 8 pm. A trip to Pondicherry is not complete until you visit the quaint, soulful town of Auroville, established by people from 50 countries in pursuit of peace and harmony. Its streets display small boutique shops selling casual, bohemian attire and Ayurvedic wellness products. Auroville’s quaint eateries are also a must-visit. The main attractions of Auroville include the Matrimandir, Auroville Bakery, and the Sound Garden. Let your trip include a quick temple run to the 500-year-old Arulmigu Manakula Vinayagar Temple located in White Town. The main attractions of this vibrant pilgrimage site are the temple’s gold laminated pillars and the chariot of Lord Ganesha which is built of teak wood and about 7.5 kg of gold!  Shop for hip outfits, accessories and decor at Mission Street and the many local boutiques. TWT tip: Regardless of the season, Pondicherry weather before sunset can be quite sultry and humid. So consume a lot of liquids to keep yourself hydrated and hire a bike if you want to avoid long walks during the day.    View this post on Instagram   A post shared by The Wander Therapy (@thewandertherapyofficial) What Is The Distance Between Pondicherry & Chennai? Pondicherry is about 150 km from Chennai – 3 to 3 ½ hour drive. How To Go To Pondicherry From Chennai? We suggest you start early in the morning if you’re driving and stop for a traditional South Indian breakfast at Adyar Anand Bhavan (A2B) near Mahabalipuram or Murugan Idli on OMR. You can also take a direct bus from the Thiruvanmiyur Depot to Pondicherry. Check out sites like AbhiBus or RedBus for the best deals on AC and non-AC bus options.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Pondicherry? You can visit Pondicherry anytime between October and March. It’s best to avoid the summer’s scorching heat here. If the crowd doesn’t scare you, we suggest you pay a visit during Christmas to get a glimpse of the festivities.    View this post on Instagram   A post shared by The Wander Therapy (@thewandertherapyofficial) Accommodation Options In Pondicherry Pondicherry is fraught with great lodging options. From luxurious beach-view hotels such as The Promenade or the Radisson Resort Pondicherry Bay to heritage properties like Maison Perumal, Le Dupleix, Villa Shanti, and Villa Du Ocean, Pondicherry will leave you spoilt for choice. You will also find budget-friendly guest houses and hotels such as Hotel Athithi TGI Grand, Ginger and The Sunway Manor.  You can even opt for a quiet stay in Auroville for some rare cultural experiences and stay here for free if you offer volunteering services. Check out the Auroville Guest houses for some great residential stays. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Pondicherry! Adventure Activities In Pondicherry A couple of must-try adventure activities and water sports in Pondicherry include:  Surfing at Paradise Beach Boat rides to Paradise Island Paragliding and parasailing at Paradise Beach Canoeing and kayaking in the Chunnambar backwaters  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Pondicherry Woodfired Pizza Freshly baked bread & cakes Quiche Croissants  Wish to explore Pondicherry’s lanes on a bicycle with a guide? Book a tour! 2. Ooty One of the best places to visit around Chennai is Ooty (Tamil Nadu). And, don’t be surprised if you find yourself caught in traffic in this hill station during its peak season. We have put togerther a complete travel guide to Ooty as well, but here are some of the main things to do in Ooty:  Main Attractions In Ooty Indulge in a perfect nature escape by taking a leisurely stroll in the Rose Garden and Botanical Garden. Or go for a boat ride in the crystal-clear waters of the Ooty Lake. There are also some scenic picnic spots near Avalanche Lake and Emerald Lake that offer a peaceful retreat. If you’re a wildlife enthusiast, then Deer Park, Mudumalai National Park, and Mukurty National Park are a must-visit. Ooty also has plenty of trekking options and you can plan a hike to Tiger Hill, Doddabetta Peak, Pykara Waterfalls, Kalhatty Waterfalls, Catherine Waterfalls, or Katary Waterfalls. For a panoramic view of the Nilgiri Hills and the valley, head to the Needle Rock Viewpoint. A few other attractions in Ooty include Toda Temple and St. Stephens Church. Visit the tea factory to learn about tea production. Before you head back to Chennai, don’t forget to pack yourself a box of homemade chocolates. The Rum & Raisin ones are my all-time favorite!  TWT Tip: If you have an extra day in hand, take the Ooty Toy Train Ride to Coonoor (20 km from Ooty), another mesmerizing hill station and getaway from Chennai famous for its lush green tea plantations.    View this post on Instagram   A post shared by The Wander Therapy (@thewandertherapyofficial) What Is The Distance Between Ooty & Chennai? Ooty is 539 km from Chennai — 11 hr by road. How To Go To Ooty From Chennai? Drive to Ooty or take the Nilgiri Express from Chennai Central Station to Mettupalayam Station, which is 52 km from Ooty. The nearest airport to Ooty is the Coimbatore International Airport. What Are The Best Months To Visit Ooty? A good time to visit Ooty is between March and May and again from September to November.   Did You Know? The annual Ooty Flower Show in the Botanical Garden, typically in the month of May, draws thousands of tourists to this hill station every year. This enchanting exhibition showcases over 150 varieties of flowers, delighting travellers with their vibrant colors and beauty. Accommodation Options In Ooty Some of the best stays in Ooty include Willow Hill by Nature Resorts, Sterling Ooty Elk Hill, Rosewood, Sterling Ooty Fern Hill, Gem Park Ooty, Accord Highland Ooty, and Fortune Resort Sullivan Court Ooty. Check out our article on the best stays in Ooty! Adventure Activities Available In Ooty Boating at Ooty Boat House. Camping at Aventura Fern Hill. Trekking to Tiger Hill and Emerald Lake. Bird Watching and jungle safari at Mudumalai National Park, Pine Forest Ooty, and Mukurty National Park. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Ooty Homemade chocolates Ooty biscuits Ooty Varkey TWT Tip: Wish to have a quick and unique getaway from Chennai? Try an urban farm experience by Throughlocals, where you can learn organic farming and sustainable living from experts, have a picnic with friends and family, and interact with farm animals amidst lush greenery.  BOOK YOUR TOUR 3. Pulicat Pulicat is a small seaside town in the Thiruvallur District of Tamil Nadu with a history of Dutch colonization. It is well known for the Pulicat Lake, which is India‘s 2nd largest brackish water lagoon after the Chilika Lake.  Main Attractions In Pulicat The Pulicat Lake Bird Sanctuary is a bird watcher’s paradise. The lake attracts exotic birds such as the greater flamingos, spot-billed pelican, grey heron, little tern and hundreds of migratory birds flying in from Siberia and the Himalayan regions. The sanctuary is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. for visitors. The Nelapattu Bird Sanctuary is about a 38 minutes drive from the Pulicat Lake Bird Sanctuary and is one of the most significant pelican habitats in South-East Asia. Timings: 9 a.m – 5 p.m every day. The Dutch Cemetery and Fort Geldria are two well-known colonial heritage sites that you could visit during your trip to Pulicat, if you are fascinated by historical structures and stories. The cemetery, built in 1656 AD, is open from Monday to Saturday from 10 am to 5 pm.  You can also check out the Satish Dhawan Space Centre and the Space Museum at Sriharikota, which are located about 11 km from the Pulicat Bird Sanctuary. The space center is open from 9 am to 5 pm on all weekdays.  What Is The Distance Between Pulicat & Chennai? Pulicat is about 65 km from Chennai – 2 hour 30 minutes drive.  How To Go To Pulicat From Chennai? Besides self-driving, you can take the metro from Guindy Station or Little Mount Station till the Wimco Nagar Metro and then take the 595 bus to Pulicat (Pazhaverkadu). The boating sites are another 10-minute walk away from the bus stop.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Pulicat? The best time to visit Pulicat for bird watching is between October and March. You can also visit the place during the Flamingo Festival organized by the government in January. The festival sprawls over various venues surrounding Pulicat Lake and features stalls from the Forest and Animal Husbandry departments. Accommodation Options In Pulicat Hotel Smart City Park Inn offers good food and lodging options and is located about 35 minutes from the Pulicat Bird Sanctuary. There are a couple of Oyo Hotels as well, but since the place is quite close to Chennai, you may as well choose a good lodging option inside the city.  Adventure Activities In Pulicat There are a number of tourist agencies near Pulicat Lake that conduct boating and bird watching activities.  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Pulicat  Biriyani Dosa Uthapam 4. Yelagiri Spend a romantic weekend encapsulated by lush green mountains at the hill station of Yelagiri (Tamil Nadu). While the mountain range is popular amongst trekkers, you can also indulge in a resort experience. Enjoy some traditional food and savor the breathtaking scenic landscapes.  Main Attractions In Yelagiri Fulfill your bird watching desire at the Fundera Birds Park and catch a glimpse of some rare exotic birds. The park is open from 9.30 am to 6.30 pm on all days. The Attaru River cascades over rocks and plunges 15 m to form the spectacular Jalagamparai Falls. Located slightly in the interiors of Yelagiri, it is about an hour’s trek from Nilavoor or can be reached via private transport. A scenic trekking trail cuts through the mountain and leads you to the highest point of the Yelagiri Hills, the Swamimalai Hills. The entry fees are Rs. 350 per person and is totally worth the view that awaits you at the top. A few other tourist attractions in Yelagiri are the Velavan Temple, Yelagiri Herbal Garden, and Yelagiri Nature Park. What Is The Distance Between Yelagiri & Chennai? Yelagiri is about 227 km from Chennai —  5 to 6 hour drive. How To Go To Yelagiri From Chennai? There are a couple of trains like the Yelagiri Express that you can take from the Chennai Central Railway Station to Jolarpettai and then a local bus to reach Yelagiri, if you’re not driving.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Yelagiri? While many travel to Yelagiri to beat the summer heat of Chennai, the best time to enjoy this place is from November to February. Accommodation Options In Yelagiri Some highly rated lodging options that offer great scenic views of the hills are Hotel Landmark, La Flora Cloud9 Resort, Hotel Kumararraja Palace and Sterling Yelagiri. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Yelagiri! Adventure Activities In Yelagiri The Mountain View Adventure Park has various adventure sports in store for tourists. Some of these include ziplining, human slingshot, bungee jumping, ATV rides and aerial rope activities. They also organize campfires and tent stays.   The Thrill Valley is also another such adventure park that offers similar adventure activities.  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Yelagiri Dosa Idli, sambar Biriyani 5. Horsley Hills Prepare to be mesmerized by cascading waterfalls, tranquil lakes and scenic trails winding up the mountains as you head to the Horsley Hills in Andhra Pradesh for a relaxed vacation. Main Attractions In Horsley Hills One of the main tourist attractions of Horsley Hills is Kaigal Falls. Surrounded by lush greenery, the water cascades down from a height of 40 meters, creating a captivating site. Also, check out the Naniyala Elephant Camp and the Chelimichenu Waterfalls located at a distance of about 40 km from Kaigal Falls. Located close to the Horsley Hills bus station, Gangotri Lake offers a serene environment for romantic nature walks. The Chennakeshava temple is a beautiful historical site  that dates back to the Chola period. Its magnificent display of architectural grandeur is sure to leave you fascinated. Trek to some of the highest viewpoints of Horsley Hills such as the Whisper Winds viewpoint, Galibanda viewpoint and the Horsley Hills Sunrise Point, located close to each other, for a panoramic view of the mountains.  What Is The Distance Between Horsley Hills & Chennai? The Horsley Hills lie at a distance of about 277 km from Chennai — 6-hour 30-minute drive. How To Go To Horsley Hills From Chennai? Besides driving, you can take a train from Chennai Central Station to Bangalore Cantt. Station, and then another direct train to Madanapalle station. Horsley Hills is just 26 km from the station with plenty of public transport options available. What Are The Best Months To Visit Horsley Hills? The peak season begins in December and lasts till March.   Accommodation Options In Horsley Hills Many budget-friendly homestays and hotels are available near Horsley Hills in Madanapalle. Some of the highly-rated properties include the VSR Wind Wave which offers cozy cottages for stay and Horsley Hills Holiday Homes Resort. Adventure Activities In Horsley Hills Rock climbing, trekking and camping at Horsley Hills are the common adventure activities in Horsley Hills, The Freakouts Adventure Zone at Horsley Hills also has some good aerial rope activities and others for its visitors.  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Horsley Hills Alasanda Wada Ragi Sankati Jonne Rotte 6. Yercaud Nestled in the Salem district of Tamil Nadu, the hill station of Yercaud beckons tourists to experience its many natural treasures. From lush green coffee plantations, and teak wood forests to serene lakes and cascading waterfalls await your exploration.  Main Attractions In Yercaud Boating in the Yercaud Lake (Emerald Lake) is sure to be etched in your memory. The boat house offers different boat options and is open from 9 am to 5.30 pm on all days of the week. There are a couple of parks surrounding the lake which are also worth a visit. Kiliyur Waterfalls is a beautiful seasonal waterfall that can be accessed by a steep trek up the hills. Approximately 11 km from the bustling town of Yercaud lies the serene Kottachedu Teak Forest. To truly immerse yourself in its natural splendor, embark on a leisurely stroll or drive along the winding road, flanked by dense foliage on both sides. Other attractions include the Lady’s Seat (observation point), Pagoda Point (viewpoint), Rose Garden, and the Botanical Garden. What Is The Distance Between Yercaud & Chennai? Yercaud is about 350 km from Chennai — 7 hr 30 minutes drive. How To Go To Yercaud From Chennai? You can drive from Chennai or take a train/travel bus to Salem and then get a cab or a bus to reach Yercaud. What Are The Best Months To Visit Yercaud? You can visit anytime between October and June. Accommodation Options In Yercaud Some of the highly-rated lodging options include Grand Palace Hotel And Spa, and Great Trails Yercaud by GRT Hotels. However, if you desire some offbeat exploration, check out the Tipperary Estate, a property built by author Charles Dickens and his family. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Yercaud! Adventure Activities In Yercaud Boating at Yercaud Lake. Trekking at Kiliyur Waterfalls. Zipline, ATV and other rope activities at Poppy Hills Adventure Park (10 am to 6 pm) and Grange TreeTop Adventure Park  (10 am to 6 pm). Paintball game at Paintball At Yercaud (10 am to 6 pm). Camping at Wilde Troupe- Camping Grounds and Yercaud Trekker’s Tenting & Glamping Stay Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Yercaud Dosa Appam Uthappam Gun powder chutney Well-equipped for your trips? You might find this article helpful: 13 Best Travel Gadgets & Accessories In India 7. Valparai Located in the picturesque Anamalai Hills (Tamil Nadu), this enchanting hill station is renowned for its lush tea and coffee plantations. Main Attractions In Valparai  The Tea Estate Garden and the Karamalai Tea Estate are definitely worth a visit. There is also a Balaji temple and a small waterfall inside the Karamalai Tea Estate which makes the place all the more enchanting. Visit the Anaimalai Tiger Reserve to catch a glimpse of wildlife in their natural habitat. Other attractions of Valparai include the Aliyar, Sholayar and Nirar Dams, the Thalanaar waterfalls, the Birla waterfalls and the Aaro viewpoint. What Is The Distance Between Valparai & Chennai? Valparai is about 590 km from Chennai — 11 hr drive. How To Go To Valparai From Chennai? You can drive or take a train to Pollachi station and then a TNSTC bus or a cab to Valparai. The nearest airport is Coimbatore, which is 100 km away from Valparai. What Are The Best Months To Visit Valparai? Anytime between October and March. Accommodation Options In Valparai There are many budget-friendly homestays and hotels available such as Hotel Saravana Grand, Sun Home Stay, Hill View Cottage, and Mary Land Home Stay. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Valparai! Adventure Activities In Valparai Bird Watching. Vehicle Safari and Elephant Camp Visit at Anamalai Tiger Reserve.  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Valparai Masala Dosa Sambar Chettinadu curries 8. Mysore The city of Mysore (Karnataka) attracts tourists from all over the world for its royal heritage and architectural grandeur.  Main Attractions In Mysore Adorned with intricate artwork, the Mysore Palace stands as a testament to the city’s royal history. It is open on all days from 10 am to 5.30 pm and has an entry fee of Rs 100. Make sure not to miss the night view of the palace as its grandeur amplifies tenfold when bathed in the enchanting glow of golden lights. Shri Chennakeshava Swami Temple is a renowned historical site famous for its artistic stone carvings and a display of the Hoysala architecture. You can visit it any time between 8.30 am to 5.30 pm. Other attractions of Mysore to include in your itinerary are St. Philomena’s Cathedral, Sri Venugopalaswamy Temple, and Karanji Lake. Dine at the iconic century-old Mylari restaurant. It is famous for their unique soft and fluffy dosas. What Is The Distance Between Mysore & Chennai? Mysore is 474 km from Chennai — 8 hr 30 minutes drive. How To Go To Mysore From Chennai? You can easily reach Mysore via a direct flight, taxi or a train from Chennai, if you’re not self driving. What Are The Best Months To Visit Mysore? Anytime between October and February. Accommodation Options In Mysore Some of the best stay options include Grand Mercure Mysore, Country Inn Mysore, Southern Star Mysore, Fortune JP Palace, Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Mysore, and Hotel Rio Meridian. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Mysore! Adventure Activities In Mysore Boating, Jet skiing and Rafting in Varuna Lake Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Mysore Mysore Masala Dosa Mysore Bonda Mysore Pak Mysore Filter Coffee 9. Kodaikanal The picturesque hill station of Kodaikanal (Tamil Nadu) situated in the upper Palani Hills, is sure to come to mind while listing tourist places around Chennai.  Breathtaking granite cliffs, tranquil lakes, dense pine forests and cascading waterfalls blend to paint a mesmerizing artwork of nature’s wonders in Kodaikanal. Main Attractions In Kodaikanal Kodaikanal has some of the best lakes and parks that make it ideal for a romantic vacation. These include Bryant Park, Coaker’s Walk, Kodaikanal Lake, Berijam Lake and Mannavanur Lake. Head to the Pillar Rocks Viewpoint for a thrilling view of the valley and mountains. Though the Guna Caves are closed for safety reasons, the serpentine tree roots above the ground are sure to leave you mystified. Some of the best waterfalls that offer a good hiking experience include the Bear Shola Falls, Vattakanal Falls and the Silver Cascade Falls. A visit to the Pine Forest is an absolute must as the sweet aroma of pine cones and the sight of exquisite birds offer you a great nature escape. A few other attractions in Kodaikanal include the Silent Valley Viewpoint, Dolphin’s Nose, Chettiar Park, Kurinji Andavar Temple and La Saleth Church. What Is The Distance Between Kodaikanal & Chennai? Kodaikanal is about 510 km from Chennai — 9 hr 30 minutes drive. How To Go To Kodaikanal From Chennai? Drive to the hill station or catch a direct train available from Chennai Egmore Station to Kodaikanal Road Railway Station. From here, you can take a cab to the hill station. However, the fastest way to travel is by a flight to Madurai airport and then a cab/ TNSTC bus to Kodaikanal. What Are The Best Months To Visit Kodaikanal? Any time between October and March. Accommodation Options In Kodaikanal A couple of luxurious stays in Kodaikanal include the Kodai Resort Hotel, Mango Hill Kodai, The Carlton, Le Poshe by Sparsa, and the Sterling Kodai Lake. Other good stays to consider are Hotel Kodai International, The Hamuse Hotel and Hotel Cliffton. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Kodaikanal! Adventure Activities In Kodaikanal A couple of theme parks in Kodaikanal like the Xtreme Zone, and Kollywood Theme Park are dedicated to adventure activities. Horse Riding, Boating, Kayaking, and Zipline are available at Mannavanur Lake. Boating at Kodaikanal Lake. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Kodaikanal Biriyani Momos Mini Idlis 10. Wayanad Wayanad (Kerala) is a picturesque paradise nestled amidst the Western Ghats that is known for its abundant natural beauty. A trip to this enchanting hill station with its mesmerizing waterfalls, mysterious caves and lush green landscapes feels nothing short of a fantasy adventure. Main Attractions In Wayanad Start your journey with a trip to the archaeological wonder Edakkal Caves. These 2 prehistoric caves are famous for their stone carvings that probably date back to 5000 B.C. Embark on a forest adventure at Kuruvadweep and enjoy a bamboo raft ride across River Kabini. It is open from 9 am to 3 pm. Go trekking at Banasura Hill and be mesmerized by its scenic beauty. Check out the Banasura Hill Waterfall and the earthen Banasura Sagar Dam located at the base of the mountain. Learn sustainable bamboo crafts, shop and know about its immense potential at the Uravu bamboo workshop and manufacturing centre. The Chembra Peak in Meppadi is the highest peak in Wayanad beckoning both trekkers and nature enthusiasts. Understand tribal history and traditional at En Ooru Tribal Heritage Village. A few other attractions in Wayanad include Soochipara Falls, Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary, Pazhassi Raja Tomb, and the Ancient Jain Temple. What Is The Distance Between Wayanad & Chennai? Wayanad is about 652 Km from Chennai — 13 hr drive. How To Go To Wayanad From Chennai? By road or take a train/ flight from Chennai to Kozhikode, which is about 90 km from Wayanad. What Are The Best Months To Visit Wayanad? October to February is the best time to visit Wayanad. Accommodation Options In Wayanad Some of the top-rated lodging options in Wayanad are Hotel Indriya, Hotel Mint Flower, Sterling Wayanad, and KTDC Pepper Grove. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Wayanad! Adventure Activities Available In Wayanad Trekking at Edakkal Caves, Banasura Hills and Chembra Peak. Boat ride at Kuruvadweep, Banasura Sagar Dam. Zipline at Wayanad Adventure Camp Karlad Lake. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Wayanad Appam and stew Puttu Idiyappam Malabar biriyani Sadhya   View this post on Instagram   A post shared by Sam’s Vegan Food Directory (@vegan_foodie_india) 11. Munnar Munnar (Kerala) is one of the most frequented weekend getaways near Chennai. Experience the natural beauty of God’s Own Country that once served as a resort for the elites of the British Raj. Several Indian films have been shot in this hill station, including Chennai Express and Dil Se.  Main Attractions In Munnar Munnar has some of the most striking trekking trails. These include the Athirapally Water Falls, Meesapulimala, Attukad Waterfalls, Lakkam Waterfalls, Kolukkumalai Tea Estate (a jeep safari option is also available), Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, and Bose Peak. If you are a tea lover, then definitely visit the Tea Museum at Nullataanni, where you can take a stroll through the tea plantation. They also offer tea-tasting and buying options (their Jasmine-flavored Green tea being my personal favorite). A couple of great viewpoints in Munnar that offer the perfect backdrop for some cinematic photographs are the Pallivasal Viewpoint, the Pothamedu Viewpoint, and the 2nd Mile Viewpoint.  If you have some extra time we recommend you catch some spectacular Kalari and Kathakali performances by local artists at the Kalari Kshethra and the Punarjani Traditional Village. Shop for spices and chocolates at the local shops. What Is The Distance Between Munnar & Chennai? Munnar is 573 km from Chennai. How To Go To Munnar From Chennai? By road, Munnar takes about 11 hours from Chennai. However, a flight to Madurai and then a cab to Munnar is the quickest way to the hill station. What Are The Best Months To Visit Munnar? October to February is the best time to visit Munnar.  Accommodation Options In Munnar If you are in search of farm stays, the Dew Drops Farm Resort by Maat Hotels is a good choice. Coonoor Draped in lush green tea gardens, Coonoor is one of the most beautiful hill stations in the Nilgiris. While parts of Sim’s Park have gorgeous rose bowers, a children’s park, and a boat house, the rest of it features winding trails cutting through wild foliage. If the weather is favorable, you’ll be able to catch a mesmerizing view of the Sleeping Lady, a mountain that resembles a woman in a supine position! Surrounded by pristine nature, Laws Falls is a quaint waterfall located about 10 km from Coonoor. It’s the perfect location for an immersive experience in nature. Kotagiri Indulge in the sweeping vistas of tea plantations and blue mountains in the quaint hill station of Kotagiri. Discovered by John Sullivan, who founded the British settlement at Ooty, Kotagiri literally translates to land/mountain of the Kota tribe.  Main Attractions In Kotagiri The stunning Catherine Waterfalls cascading from a height of around 76 m is a mesmerizing sight. Though tourists can only enjoy this scenic spectacle from a distant viewpoint, the entire area is enveloped in tea estates, forming a dreamlike destination. A perfect getaway from the crowded areas of the hill station. Find out about the life and history of the founder of Kotagiri at the John Sullivan Memorial. It is a well-maintained museum with various artifacts from the colonial period. Other tourist attractions in Kotagiri are Kodanad View Point, Rangaswamy Peak, and Sri Arulmigu Karumariamman Temple. What Is The Distance Between Kotagiri & Chennai? Kotagiri is located at a distance of 537 Km from Chennai.  How To Go To Kotagiri From Chennai? Tirupati Fine weather, embracing hills and swarms of devotees welcome you to the sacred city of Tirupati (Andhra Pradesh). It is one of the best tourist places near Chennai that has been the seat of culture and religion for centuries. Main Attractions In Tirupati For ages now, devotees have been ascending the six peaks of the Sapthagiri hill to catch a glimpse of Lord Venkateshwara enthroned atop the seventh peak in Tirupati. There are two ways that lead to the Sri Venkateswara Swamy Vaari Temple. The longer route begins from Alipiri and consists of a 3,550 steps climb while the shorter one known as the Srivari Mettu path has 2,388 steps. The temple has special facilities for senior citizens which can be availed by showing their ID proof at the counter. Apart from visiting spiritual destinations such as the Sri Padmavathi Ammavaari Temple and the Shri Varaha Swamy Temple, also check out the Swami Pushkarini (sacred lake), Tirumala Deer Park Reserve, Natural Arch (Silathoranam) – a geoheritage site, Jungle Book Waterfalls, Kapila Teertham Waterfalls, and the Talakona Waterfalls. Gandikota A historic fort, a natural gorge and dominating granite cliffs await your exploration at the mesmerizing village of Gandikota in Andhra Pradesh.  Main Attractions In Gandikota Bearing a close resemblance to the famous Grand Canyon in the United States, the Gandikota Gorge is formed by the river Pennar which flows through the magnificent Erramala Hills, carving out a deep and picturesque canyon over the centuries. The Penna River viewpoint and the Gandikota River viewpoint provide breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes. Naturally protected by the gorge, the Gandikota Fort has served various dynasties such as the Chalukyas, Golconda Sultanate and others. The panoramic view from the fort of the surrounding landscapes adds to the allure of this historical monument. Attractions within the fort include the Charminar, Kathula Koneru (pond), Madhavaraya Swamy Temple, and the Raghunatha Swamy Temple. Other places of interest at and near Gandikota are the Jumma Masjid, Owk Reservoir, Owk Waterfalls, Belum Caves and the Mylavaram Dam. What Is The Distance Between Gandikota & Chennai? Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Thekkady! Adventure Activities Available In Thekkady Elephant rides at Elephant Junction Trekking, camping and Boat ride at Periyar Tiger Reserve. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Thekkady Kerala Sadya Idiyappam Appam Trekking Spots Near Chennai 1. Kolli Hills The trek to the summit of Kolli Hills (Namakkal District, Tamil Nadu) commences from the village of Puliancholai nestled at the base of the hills. The journey takes you through dense greenery overlooking verdant landscapes and culminates with the sight of the Agaya Gangai Waterfalls cascading from a height of 91 m. If you are new to the place, we recommend booking a guided trek with a tourism organization. Other Attractions At Kolli Hills Seeku Parai Viewpoint, Maasila Falls, Namma Falls, Tampcol Medical Farm, Arulmigu Sri Thathagiri Murugan Temple, Botanical Garden, Puliyancholai Park, and the Arappaleeswarar Temple. What Is The Distance Between Kolli Hills From Chennai? Kolli Hills is 358 km away from Chennai — 8 hour drive. How To Go To Kolli Hills From Chennai? Drive to Kolli Hills or take a train to Salem and then hire a private vehicle to reach Kolli Hills. However, the route consists of 70 dangerous hairpin bends and requires skilful driving.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Kolli Hills? You can visit Kolli Hills between September and March.  Accommodation Options In Kolli Hills Some of the highly-rated lodging options include RVR Rejoice Villa Resorts, Silverline Retreat Hotels and RJ Grand Resort. Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Kolli Hills! Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Kolli Hills Dosa Mullaga Bhajji Barota 2. Tada falls Or Ubbalamadugu Waterfalls Source: thejerker The Tada Falls located amidst the Siddulaiah Forest in the Chittoor district (Andhra-Chennai border) is truly a trekker’s paradise. The trail starts from Tada Falls’ parking lot and goes over rocky terrain and dense foliage to reach the Shiva temple on top.  There are 3 base camps and you can take your vehicle up to the first one. The path till the temple is well charted on google maps. However, if you wish to go further, it is advisable to seek guidance from the local people. What Is The Distance Between Tada Falls & Chennai? Tada Falls is about 106 km from Chennai. How To Go To Tada Falls From Chennai? A couple of Hyderabad or Visakhapatnam bound tour buses such as Orange Travels, Kkaveri Travels or Vkaveri Travels make a stop at the Tada Bus stop. However, from the bus stop to the Tada Falls parking lot one must use their own transport. There is also a Rs. 200 entry fee for Tada Falls. What Are The Best Months To Visit Tada Falls? Anytime from September to December is a good time to visit the falls. Accommodation Options In Tada Falls There is no proper accommodation near Tada Falls. Hotel Smart City Park Inn and Hotel KVR Residency are good hotels located about an hour away from the Tada bike parking lot. Local Culinary Specialities To Try Near Tada Falls Dosa Barota Bhajji 3. Nagalapuram Falls Source: MakeMyTrip The Nagalapuram (Andhra Pradesh) trek takes you through a scenic route and unveils 5 mesmerizing waterfalls in the region. As you may need to wade through water, swimmers will feel more comfortable. However, it’s important to note that the trail is more challenging than Tada Falls, making it unsuitable for young children and the elderly.  Begin your trek from the Nagalapuram parking slot at 8 am. A 3 km walk through the forest takes you to the first waterfall. However, it is advisable that you head straight to the 4th falls and enjoy a dip in the water. Check out the first 3 falls on your way back as the entry would be closed by 3 pm and it takes about 2.5 to 3 hours one way.  What Is The Distance Between Nagalapuram Falls & Chennai? It is located about 100 km away from Chennai.  How To Go To Nagalapuram Falls From Chennai? The Nagalapuram Falls is about a 3-hour drive from Chennai and you can drive to the place.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Nagalapuram Falls? The best time to visit is between October and February.  Accommodation Options In Nagalapuram Falls  A few lodging options are located at a distance of about 45 minutes from the Nagalapuram Falls parking lot. These include Amma Pride Inn Resort, RS Residency, and Swathi Residency. Local Culinary Specialities To Try Near Nagalapuram Falls Andhra meals Dosa 4. Aare Falls Source: YouTube The Aare waterfalls in the Nagalapuram district of Andhra Pradesh is another hidden gem that has recently gained popularity amongst adventure lovers. The entry fee per head is Rs. 50 and the timings are from 8 am to 3 pm.  The first Aare Falls is called the Temple Falls owing to a quaint temple located near it. Your trek culminates at the second falls known as the Vana Ganga. The way to the 3rd Aare Falls is closed and trekkers are not allowed after this point. Warning: After a series of accidents during treks, Aare Falls was temporarily closed in 2018 for safety reasons. Though it has been reopened this year, one needs to adhere to specific timings (8 am-3 pm) and night camps or treks are no longer allowed. To ensure a safe and enjoyable experience, it is advisable to travel in groups and have a knowledgeable local guide accompany you throughout the journey. If you are not a proficient swimmer, exercise caution and avoid getting into the water, as certain areas have depths exceeding 20 feet.  What Is The Distance Between Aare Falls & Chennai? Aare or Arai Falls is about 103 km from Chennai. How To Go To Aare Falls From Chennai? The falls are about a 3-hour drive from Chennai. Thus, you can easily drive to reach here.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Aare Falls? The best time to visit is between October and February.  Accommodation Options Near Aare Falls There are no proper lodging options available near the falls. You can stay at Hotel MGM Grand or Regency Tiruttani by GRT Hotels, which are located about 36 km – 47 km away from the Arai Falls Parking lot. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Aare Falls Andhra meals Barota 5. Shivanasamudra Falls The Shivanasamudra Falls located in the Chamarajanagar district of Karnataka, consists of magnificent 2 drops known as the Barachukki and the Gaganachukki Falls. There is a Rs. 20 entry fee and ample parking space to park your vehicle. A small trek and a flight of steps take you to designated viewpoints from where you can witness River Kaveri’s roaring cascades. Other Attractions Near Shivanasamudra Falls Ancient Shri Prasanna Meenakshi And Someshwara Temple, Cauvery Wildlife Sanctuary. What Is The Distance Between Shivanasamudra Falls & Chennai? Shivanasamudra Falls is 457 km away from Chennai.  How To Go To Shivanasamudra Falls From Chennai? The falls is a 9 hour drive from Chennai. You can also take a train from Chennai Central Station to Maddur Station, which is about 48 km from the falls.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Shivanasamudra Falls? September to January is the best time to visit the falls. It is open on all days from 8 am to 5 pm. Accommodation Options In Shivanasamudra Falls There are very few good stays near the falls. Hotels like Jai Homes, Atmaveda Shivanasamudra, and ChukkiMane Village Resort are located at a distance of 21 km. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Shivanasamudra Falls Neer Dosa Idli TWT Trivia: One of the first hydroelectricity power stations in Asia was set up at the Shivanasamudra Falls in 1902. 6. Biligirirangana Hills At the converging point of the Western and Eastern Ghats rests the Biligirirangana Hills or the BR Hills (Karnataka). Famous for the BRT Wildlife Sanctuary or the BRT Tiger Reserve, this destination packs in enough adventure for a short trip near Chennai.  Within the sanctuary, there are ample opportunities for trekking. You can also take your vehicle to the top of the hills and relish the panoramic vistas. Keep your eyes open during the forest tour as luck may grant you a chance encounter with an elephant or a Sloth bear adding an extra touch of magic to your wildlife adventure.  Other Attractions Near Biligirirangana Hills Make a quick trip to the Biligiri Rangaswamy Temple located on the top of BR Hills. Apart from its religious significance the place also offers a beautiful view of the forest. What Is The Distance Between Biligirirangana Hills & Chennai? The BR Hills lie at a distance of about 514 km from Chennai. How To Go To Biligirirangana Hills From Chennai? BR Hills is a 10-hour drive from Chennai. You can also get on a train to Mysore Railway Station (79 km away) or a flight to Mysore Airport (68 km away) and then hire a cab to BR Hills. What Are The Best Months To Visit Biligirirangana Hills? October to March is the best time to visit the Biligirirangana Hills. Accommodation Options In Biligirirangana Hills There are a couple of budget-friendly homestays and hotels such as Hotel Mayura Biligiri, Shwethagiri Homestay, and Vanasiri located at half an hour’s distance from the BRT Tiger Reserve. Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Biligirirangana Hills Gobi Manchurian Tomato soup Veg meals TWT Trivia: The tiger reserve is also home to the Soliga tribe, which is one of the first indigenous tribes to fight a legal battle to reclaim their ancestral land. Initially, the tribe was evacuated by the government after the territory was declared a tiger reserve in 2006. In 2011, the court ruled in their favor and the tribe was allowed to inhabit and have access to non-timber forest products like honey. 7. Coorg This quaint hill station nestled in the Western Ghats packs in enough adventure for thrill seekers. You can contact one of the tour agencies that organize group treks and plan a hike to Nishani Betta. A trek through the forest gets you to this beautiful mountain peak hidden away in the Brahmagiri range. You can expect a scintillating view of the surrounding mountain ranges and the Cauvery River from the top. There are also a couple of other trekking trails in Coorg that you can choose from: Mandalpatti Trek  Tadiandamol Trek Pushpagiri Trek Brahmagiri Trek Iruppu Falls Trek Madikeri Trek Other Attractions In Coorg Raja’s Seat, Madikeri Fort, Abbey Falls, Mallalli Waterfalls, Iruppu Falls, Omkareshwar Temple, Dubbare Elephant Camp, Coorg Coffee Plantations, Nagarhole Tiger Reserve, Pushpagiri and Brahmagiri Wildlife Sanctuaries, and Namdroling Monastery Golden Temple. What Is The Distance Between Coorg & Chennai? Coorg or Kodagu is located at a distance of 581 km from Chennai. How To Go To Coorg From Chennai? Coorg is a 10 hour 33 minutes drive from Chennai. You can also take a train to Mysore Junction, which is 106 km from Coorg, or take a flight to Mysuru Airport (132 km) and hire a taxi to go to the hill station. What Are The Best Months To Visit Coorg? October to March is the best time to visit this hill station. Accommodation Options In Coorg Some of the luxury stay options in Coorg that offer the best nature escapes are Taj Madikeri Resort & Spa, Coorg Wilderness Resort & Spa, Coorg Cliffs (has an infinity pool), Club Mahindra Resort, The Windflower Resorts And Spa Coorg, The Ibnii, and Hotel Altitude Coorg (budget-friendly option). Reserve your stay at one of the top hotels in Coorg! Adventure Activities Available In Coorg Apart from trekking, a few other adventure activities to try out in Coorg include: Camping at Madikeri River rafting in Barapole River Rock Climbing and Zip Lining at The Quarry Adventures & Cafe Quarry Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Coorg Akki Roti Nool Puttu Kadambuttu Bamboo Shoot Curry Baby eggplant 8. Nandi Hills While planning quick weekend trips from Chennai, Nandi Hills (Karnataka) undoubtedly deserves a top spot on your list. This popular tourist spot near Chennai is named after the ancient Nandi temple situated atop the hills.  Your trekking trail begins from the Nandi Hills Trek Starting Point marked on Google Maps to the Sunset Point. On your way to the top, don’t miss the ancient ruins of Tipu Fort and Tippu Sultan’s Summer House. And before you head back, make time to visit the Sri Bhoga Nandishwara Gudi Temple and the Yoganandeeswara Swami Temple for their awe-inspiring temple architecture. What Is The Distance Between Nandi Hills & Chennai? Nandi Hills is about 339 km from Chennai. How To Go To Nandi Hills From Chennai? By road, Nandi Hills is a 7 hour 30 minutes drive. You can also avail of one of the many tour buses that run between Chennai and Bangalore. Or, take a train to Bangalore City Railway Station located 60 km from Nandi Hills or a flight to Kempegowda International Airport, 37 km from Nandi Hills. What Are The Best Months To Visit Nandi Hills? You are likely to experience the best weather conditions between September and February. Accommodation Options In Nandi Hills There are many small resorts, 3-star hotels and homestays that offer good accommodation options in Nandi Hills. Some of these include KTDC Hotel Mayura Pine Top Nandi Hills, Silver Cloud, Nandi Resort, and Nandi Mist Meadows. Adventure Activities Available In Nandi Hills Paragliding at Nandi Hills Bird watching and boating at Yediyur Lake Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Nandi Hills Uttapam Mangalore Buns Rava dosa 9. Hogenakkal Falls Located on the Kaveri River at the Tamil Nadu-Karnataka border, this majestic falls cascades down through 14 channels from varying heights of 10 to 66 ft, making it one of the best vacation spots near Chennai for trekkers and nature enthusiasts.  The Hogenakkal trek is a unique experience as it involves a coracle boat ride after a 2 km trek on foot. However, it is essential to check with the local tourism authorities before you set out for the falls as boating may be temporarily closed during heavy water flows. Other Attractions Near Hogenakkal Falls A few other places that you can check out near Hogenakkal Falls are Hanging Bridge, Cini Waterfalls, Mettur Dam, and the Biligundla Fishing and Boating Spot.  What Is The Distance Between Hogenakkal Falls & Chennai? Hogenakkal Falls is about 336 km from Chennai. How To Go To Hogenakkal Falls From Chennai? From Chennai, Hogenakkal is a 6 hour 30 minute drive. Alternatively, you can take a train from Chennai Central Station to Bommidi Railway Station, which is located 76 km away from Hogenakkal Falls.  What Are The Best Months To Visit Hogenakkal Falls? The best time to visit is between October and December. Accommodation Options In Hogenakkal Falls There are a couple of basic guest houses and 2-star hotels in Hogenakkal such as TTDC Hotel Tamil Nadu Hogenakkal and C M Hotel that offer decent stay options for a weekend trip.  Local Culinary Specialities To Try In Hogenakkal Falls Dosa Idli Biriyani Frequently Asked Questions On Things To Do In Chennai  1. I will be in Chennai for 2 days. What sightseeing places can I cover? A. Chennai is a happening metropolitan city that is sure to keep you busy with its amazing eco-parks, historical forts and monuments, temples and of course some of the most stunning and inviting beaches. The main attractions in the city that are a must-visit: Marina Beach, Gandhi Beach, Besant Nagar, Thiruvanmiyur Beach Guindy Deer Park, The Madras Crocodile Bank Trust, Snake Park, Chetpet Ecopark Madras War Cemetery, Dr MGR Memorial,  Chennai Lighthouse, Fort St. George, Dakshin Chitra Heritage Museum, Government Museum Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Arulmigu Sri Parthasarathy Perumal Temple, Santhome Cathedral Basilica. There are also many dance performances (Bharatanatyam) and art and craft exhibitions that keep happening around the year in places like Kalakshetra. Also, the city’s famous Biryani and Chettinad cuisine is a must-try. 2. Is there anything special about Chennai? A. Chennai is known for its happening beaches, spicy cuisine, traditional Bharatanatyam dance performances and breathtaking temple architecture.  3. What foods are a must-try when in Chennai? A. The most popular delicacies to try out in Chennai are various Dosa varieties, Mini Idli, Vada, the delicious Coconut Chutney, Biriyani, Idiyappam, Idli-Sambar-Chutney, Pongal, Adai and Avial, Kuzhi Paniyaram, Jigarthanda, Murukku (from Adyar Anand Bhavan) and Mysurpak (from Sri Krishna Sweets).  4. What can we shop in Chennai? A. Some of the best things to buy during your trip to Chennai are Kanchipuram silk sarees, Thanjavur dancing dolls, gold jewelry (Chennai is known for its high gold purity), Thanjavur paintings, and Kemp stone dance jewelry. 5. Is Nagalapuram a safe place? A. As the area is isolated, Nagalapuram is not recommended for solo travel. It is advised that you visit the place during the day with a large group and preferably a local guide.   6. Is Chennai a good place to visit? A. Chennai is one of the best metropolitan cities that offer a beautiful blend of traditional culture and modern lifestyle. From gorgeous temples to some of the biggest shopping malls (Phoenix Market City), Skywalk PVR cinemas adjoining the airport, to great eateries serving mouth-watering delicacies and metro connectivity, Chennai makes for a thrilling city trip.  7. Is Chennai a safe city? A. Chennai is a relatively safe city when compared to some other parts of India. In fact, it is ranked as one of the safest cities in the world according to a recent survey.  TWT Summary If your fast-paced life leaves you with little time for self-indulgence, our quick guide to nearby places to visit in Chennai is perfect for you. All of the above holiday destinations near Chennai are located within a distance of 500- 600 km and can be visited during weekends.  Head to popular hill stations like Ooty, Wayanad, Yelagiri and Kodaikanal for a romantic getaway. Or pack your backpack for some thrilling treks in Coorg, Hogenakkal Falls, or Nandi Hills. You can also check out our review of a beachside restaurant in Chennai or our list of best 3o veg restaurants in Chennai if you’re staying in the city for a while.  Wherever you decide to travel, our curated list offers a quick glance at the main attractions, best stays, ideal time to visit, and most importantly the exciting adventure activities that await you on your next trip.  Frequent Traveler?
